Operation 'CreateSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is minimal and lacks critical details. Improved version explains the certificate's purpose (SAML verification), what inputs are required (certificate body, integration ID), what is returned (certificate object with ID), and the side effect (immediate availability). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create an SSO certificate.**
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new SAML SSO certificate
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new SAML certificate for SSO integration. The certificate is used to verify requests between your Identity Provider and Twilio SendGrid. Requires the certificate body with public certificate data and associated integration ID. Returns the created certificate object with its unique identifier and metadata. The certificate becomes immediately available for use with the specified SSO integration.
data.reasoning: Original description is minimal and lacks critical details. Improved version explains the certificate's purpose (SAML verification), what inputs are required (certificate body, integration ID), what is returned (certificate object with ID), and the side effect (immediate availability). This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'GetSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable. Description needs enhancement to specify what parameters are required (cert_id), what fields are returned, and practical use cases for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve an individual SSO certificate.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific SAML SSO certificate by its unique identifier. Returns the complete certificate object including the public certificate data, associated integration ID, creation timestamp, and other metadata. Requires the certificate ID as a path parameter. Use this operation to verify certificate details or retrieve certificate information for validation purposes.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description needs enhancement to specify what parameters are required (cert_id), what fields are returned, and practical use cases for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'UpdateSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate. Description needs clarification on partial update support, what fields can be modified, immediate effect on integrations, and how to obtain certificate IDs. This improves AI agent understanding of update behavior and side effects.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update an existing certificate by ID.**

You can retrieve a certificate's ID from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing SAML SSO certificate identified by its unique ID. Supports partial updates - only provided fields in the request body will be modified. Returns the updated certificate object with all current properties. Changes take effect immediately for the associated SSO integration. Certificate IDs can be retrieved from the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint or from certificate creation responses.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description needs clarification on partial update support, what fields can be modified, immediate effect on integrations, and how to obtain certificate IDs. This improves AI agent understanding of update behavior and side effects.

message: Operation 'DeleteSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear. Description needs details about permanence of deletion, impact on associated integrations, response format, and precautions. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature of this operation and when it's appropriate to use.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete an SSO certificate.**

You can retrieve a certificate's ID from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes an SSO certificate identified by its unique ID. Once deleted, the certificate cannot be recovered and will no longer be available for SAML verification with its associated SSO integration. Returns a success response with no content. Ensure the certificate is no longer in use before deletion. Certificate IDs can be retrieved from the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear. Description needs details about permanence of deletion, impact on associated integrations, response format, and precautions. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature of this operation and when it's appropriate to use.

message: Operation 'CreateSsoIntegration' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary and description are too generic. Improved version specifies SAML 2.0 protocol, explains required inputs (IdP name, entity ID, SAML parameters), return value (integration object with ID), and side effects (immediate availability, certificate association capability). This enables AI agents to understand the integration setup process.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create an SSO integration.**
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new SAML 2.0 SSO integration
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new SAML 2.0 SSO integration for your Twilio SendGrid account. Requires configuration details such as the Identity Provider name, entity ID, and other SAML parameters in the request body. Returns the created integration object with a unique ID, status, and configuration details. The integration is immediately available for use with SSO Teammates and can be associated with SAML certificates for request verification.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are too generic. Improved version specifies SAML 2.0 protocol, explains required inputs (IdP name, entity ID, SAML parameters), return value (integration object with ID), and side effects (immediate availability, certificate association capability). This enables AI agents to understand the integration setup process.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all SSO integrations tied to your Twilio SendGrid account.**

The IDs returned by this endpoint can be used by the APIs additional endpoints to modify your SSO integrations.
data.summary_suggestion: List all SSO integrations for account
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all SAML 2.0 SSO integrations configured for your Twilio SendGrid account. Returns an array of integration objects, each containing the integration ID, name, Identity Provider details, entity ID, and configuration status. The integration IDs returned can be used with other SSO API endpoints to retrieve, update, or delete specific integrations, and to manage associated certificates and SSO Teammates.
data.reasoning: Summary could be more specific about listing all integrations. Description needs clarification on return format (array of objects), what fields are included in each integration object, and how IDs are used across the API ecosystem. This helps AI agents understand the foundational nature of this operation.

data.current_description:

data.current_summary: Get All SSO Certificates by Integration
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all your IdP configurations by configuration ID.**

The `integration_id` expected by this endpoint is the `id` returned in the response by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all SAML 2.0 certificates associated with a specific SSO integration. Requires the integration ID, which can be retrieved from the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint. Returns an array of certificate objects containing public certificates and metadata used for verifying SAML requests between your IdP and Twilio SendGrid.
data.reasoning: The current description incorrectly states it retrieves 'IdP configurations' when it actually retrieves certificates. Fixed terminology inconsistency and added clarity about what certificates are returned and their purpose in SAML verification to improve AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'DeleteSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear. data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete an SSO certificate.**

You can retrieve a certificate's ID from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an SSO certificate by its ID. Removes the certificate from your Twilio SendGrid account. The certificate will no longer be available for use with SSO integrations. If the certificate is currently in use by an active integration, the deletion may fail or require the integration to be reconfigured. Returns a success response with no body on successful deletion. Certificate IDs can be retrieved from the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear. Description lacks important details about side effects and constraints. Added information about what happens when a certificate is deleted, potential failure scenarios if the certificate is in use, and clarified the response format to help AI agents understand the operation's consequences.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create an SSO integration.**
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new SAML 2.0 SSO integration
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new SAML 2.0 SSO integration for your Twilio SendGrid account. Each integration corresponds to a specific identity provider (IdP) such as Okta, Duo, or Microsoft Azure Active Directory. Requires integration configuration details in the request body including IdP metadata and authentication settings. Returns the created integration object with its ID and configuration details. The integration is immediately available for assigning to SSO teammates.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are too generic. Enhanced summary to specify SAML 2.0 and clarify this is for SSO setup. Expanded description to explain what an integration represents, which IdPs are supported, what inputs are required, what is returned, and when the integration becomes usable. This provides critical context for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose and scope.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all your IdP configurations by configuration ID.**

The `integration_id` expected by this endpoint is the `id` returned in the response by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all SAML 2.0 certificates associated with a specific SSO integration. Returns a list of certificates that are used to verify authentication requests between the IdP and Twilio SendGrid. Requires the integration ID, which can be retrieved from the Get All SSO Integrations endpoint. Each certificate includes metadata such as public certificate content, creation date, and expiration information.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear. Description is misleading - it says 'retrieve IdP configurations' but actually retrieves certificates. Terminology is inconsistent (mixing 'IdP configurations' with certificates). Enhanced version clarifies the operation retrieves certificates, explains their purpose in SAML 2.0 authentication, and describes what certificate metadata is returned.

Operation 'CreateSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is minimal and lacks critical details. Added context about SAML certificate purpose, what inputs are required, what is returned, and when the certificate becomes available. Enhanced summary to specify SAML context for better AI agent understanding of the certificate type being created.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create an SSO certificate.**
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new SAML SSO certificate
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new SAML certificate for SSO authentication. The certificate is used to verify requests between your identity provider and Twilio SendGrid. Requires the certificate data in the request body. Returns the created certificate object with its ID and metadata. The certificate becomes immediately available for use with SSO integrations.
data.reasoning: Original description is minimal and lacks critical details. Added context about SAML certificate purpose, what inputs are required, what is returned, and when the certificate becomes available. Enhanced summary to specify SAML context for better AI agent understanding of the certificate type being created.

message: Operation 'GetSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to specify what certificate details are returned, clarify the ID parameter requirement, and explain use cases for retrieving individual certificates to help AI agents determine when to use this operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve an individual SSO certificate.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific SAML SSO certificate by its ID. Returns the certificate details including the public certificate data, associated integration ID, and metadata. Use this operation to verify certificate configuration or retrieve certificate details for validation purposes.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to specify what certificate details are returned, clarify the ID parameter requirement, and explain use cases for retrieving individual certificates to help AI agents determine when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate. Description needs clarification on what fields can be updated, whether partial updates are supported, what is returned, and when changes take effect. Added context about immediate availability of changes to help AI agents understand the operation's side effects.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update an existing certificate by ID.**

You can retrieve a certificate's ID from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing SAML SSO certificate identified by its ID. Allows modification of certificate data and associated metadata. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated certificate object. Changes take effect immediately for all SSO integrations using this certificate. Certificate IDs can be retrieved from the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description needs clarification on what fields can be updated, whether partial updates are supported, what is returned, and when changes take effect. Added context about immediate availability of changes to help AI agents understand the operation's side effects.

message: Operation 'DeleteSsoCertificate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear. Description lacks important details about side effects and constraints. Added information about what happens when a certificate is deleted, potential failure scenarios if the certificate is in use, and clarified the response format to help AI agents understand the operation's consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete an SSO certificate.**

You can retrieve a certificate's ID from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an SSO certificate by its ID. Removes the certificate from your Twilio SendGrid account. The certificate will no longer be available for use with SSO integrations. If the certificate is currently in use by an active integration, the deletion may fail or require the integration to be reconfigured. Returns a success response with no body on successful deletion. Certificate IDs can be retrieved from the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear. Description lacks important details about side effects and constraints. Added information about what happens when a certificate is deleted, potential failure scenarios if the certificate is in use, and clarified the response format to help AI agents understand the operation's consequences.

message: Operation 'CreateSsoIntegration' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary and description are too generic. Enhanced summary to specify SAML 2.0 and clarify this is for SSO setup. Expanded description to explain what an integration represents, which IdPs are supported, what inputs are required, what is returned, and when the integration becomes usable. This provides critical context for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose and scope.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create an SSO integration.**
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new SAML 2.0 SSO integration
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new SAML 2.0 SSO integration for your Twilio SendGrid account. Each integration corresponds to a specific identity provider (IdP) such as Okta, Duo, or Microsoft Azure Active Directory. Requires integration configuration details in the request body including IdP metadata and authentication settings. Returns the created integration object with its ID and configuration details. The integration is immediately available for assigning to SSO teammates.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are too generic. Enhanced summary to specify SAML 2.0 and clarify this is for SSO setup. Expanded description to explain what an integration represents, which IdPs are supported, what inputs are required, what is returned, and when the integration becomes usable. This provides critical context for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose and scope.

message: Operation 'ListSsoIntegration' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary could be more specific about listing all integrations. Description needs clarification on what data is returned in each integration object and how the returned IDs are used throughout the SSO API. Enhanced to specify SAML 2.0 context and provide clearer guidance on using returned IDs with other endpoints.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all SSO integrations tied to your Twilio SendGrid account.**

The IDs returned by this endpoint can be used by the APIs additional endpoints to modify your SSO integrations.
data.summary_suggestion: List all SSO integrations for account
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all SAML 2.0 SSO integrations configured for your Twilio SendGrid account. Returns an array of integration objects, each containing the integration ID, IdP type, configuration details, and status. The integration IDs returned can be used with other SSO API endpoints to retrieve, update, or delete specific integrations, and to manage associated certificates and teammates.
data.reasoning: Summary could be more specific about listing all integrations. Description needs clarification on what data is returned in each integration object and how the returned IDs are used throughout the SSO API. Enhanced to specify SAML 2.0 context and provide clearer guidance on using returned IDs with other endpoints.

message: Operation 'GetSsoIntegration' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to specify what integration details are returned, clarify the purpose of retrieving individual integrations, and provide better context for when an AI agent should use this operation versus the list operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve an SSO integration by ID.**

You can retrieve the IDs for your configurations from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific SAML 2.0 SSO integration by its ID. Returns the complete integration configuration including IdP type, authentication settings, certificate associations, and status. Use this operation to verify integration settings or retrieve configuration details for validation. Integration IDs can be obtained from the "List All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description needs enhancement to specify what integration details are returned, clarify the purpose of retrieving individual integrations, and provide better context for when an AI agent should use this operation versus the list operation.

message: Operation 'UpdateSsoIntegration' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, not_actionable. Original summary is generic. Description has typo ('exisiting'), lacks specificity about what can be modified, and doesn't explain what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies the SAML 2.0 context, specifies partial update capability, explains parameter sourcing, and describes the response for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to modify an exisiting SSO integration.**

You can retrieve the IDs for your configurations from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Modify an existing SSO integration configuration
data.description_suggestion: Modifies an existing SAML 2.0 SSO integration configuration for your Twilio SendGrid account. Accepts partial updates to integration settings such as entity ID, login URL, or certificate details. Requires the integration ID, which can be retrieved from the Get All SSO Integrations endpoint. Returns the updated SSO integration object with all current configuration details.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic. Description has typo ('exisiting'), lacks specificity about what can be modified, and doesn't explain what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies the SAML 2.0 context, specifies partial update capability, explains parameter sourcing, and describes the response for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'DeleteSsoIntegration' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, inconsistent_terminology. Summary is adequate, but description uses inconsistent terminology ('IdP configuration' vs 'SSO integration'). Missing critical information about permanence of deletion, impact on SSO authentication, and response details. Enhanced version clarifies SAML 2.0 context, explains side effects, specifies response code, and uses consistent terminology.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete an IdP configuration by ID.**

You can retrieve the IDs for your configurations from the response provided by the "Get All SSO Integrations" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an SSO integration configuration by ID. This permanently removes the SAML 2.0 integration for the specified IdP from your Twilio SendGrid account. Requires the integration ID, which can be retrieved from the Get All SSO Integrations endpoint. Once deleted, SSO authentication through this integration will no longer be available. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description uses inconsistent terminology ('IdP configuration' vs 'SSO integration'). Missing critical information about permanence of deletion, impact on SSO authentication, and response details. Enhanced version clarifies SAML 2.0 context, explains side effects, specifies response code, and uses consistent terminology.
